selected_quotes: Details emerge on Obama's Precision Medicine Initiative — will $215 million be enough?
Obama to seek $215 million for precision-medicine plan : Nature News Comment #SmartNews
Obama to seek $215 million for #precisionmedicine plan #pm101 #bigdata. UIS and UK now investing (to compete?)
Good thing they've got that $215 genome thing!

citation.title: Obama to seek $215 million for precision-medicine plan

news.title: Obama budget seeks big boost for science
news.summary: White House plan would increase research and development funding but faces rough road in Congress.

news.title: Obama launches the precision medicine initiative
news.summary: U.S. President Obama has requested $215 million infunding in order to launch his push for personalized clinical care. This means meedicines tailor made for individual patients.

news.title: Obama Enumerates Precision Medicine Initiative
news.summary: The President requests $215 million to launch his push for personalized clinical care.

news.title: Harold Varmus to resign as head of US cancer institute
news.summary: Nobel laureate has led the National Cancer Institute since 2010.

news.title: Head of National Cancer Institute Resigns
news.summary: Nobel laureate Harold Varmus led the National Cancer Institute since 2010, after heading up NIH from 1993 to 1999 -- Read more on ScientificAmerican.com

news.title: California unveils 'precision-medicine' project
news.summary: The $3-million state initiative will coordinate with a national effort to promote individualized patient treatment.

news.title: Cancer mutations often misidentified in the clinic
news.summary: Examining normal tissue as well as tumours gives physicians a better shot at choosing effective therapies.

news.title: US tailored-medicine project aims for ethnic balance
news.summary: Massive study seeks to succeed where others failed, but faces tight deadline and questions about strategy.

news.title: US agencies plan research ethics overhaul
news.summary: Long-awaited revision proposed for regulations governing studies of human subjects.
